revised_title: Cortical Granule Exocytosis in Sea Urchin Eggs and the Effects of Inhibitors on Cytoskeletal Function
tldr: This study investigates calcium-dependent exocytosis in a secretory granule plasma membrane preparation from sea urchin eggs and the effects of some inhibitors of cytoskeletal function. The results show that exocytosis occurs in response to micromolar calcium concentrations and is unaffected by drugs that interfere with the normal function of microfilaments and microtubules. Trifluoperazine, an antagonist of the calcium-dependent regulatory protein calmodulin, inhibits exocytosis in vitro.
